sentences: Valery Yakovlevich Leontiev (Russian: Валерий Яковлевич Леонтьев; born 19 March 1949) is a Soviet and Russian pop singer, sometimes songwriter and actor whose popularity peaked in the early 1980s.
Valery Yakovlevich Leontiev (Russian: Валерий Яковлевич Леонтьев; born 19 March 1949) is a Soviet and Russian pop singer, sometimes songwriter and actor whose popularity peaked in the early 1980s.
He was titled a People's Artist of Russia in 1996.
Valery Yakovlevich Leontiev was born on 19 March 1949, in Ust-Usa, a village in what is now Russia's Komi Republic.
Valery Yakovlevich Leontiev was born on 19 March 1949, in Ust-Usa, a village in what is now Russia's Komi Republic.
In 1961 the family moved to the city Yuryevets in Ivanovo Oblast, and after graduation, Leontiev went to conquer Moscow and to act in Russian Academy of Theatre Arts.
However, panic and fear to fail in the exam made Leontiev at the last moment to take the documents and return to Yuryevets.
Here the future artist has changed many professions - from the postman to the designer, but in the end went in Vorkuta and entered the Mining Institute.
Leontiev's first performance on the big stage took place in 1971, during the Vorkuta regional competition "Song-71".
And the first concert the singer gave was on April 9, 1972 on the stage of Vorkuta's House of and Builders.
From this moment begins the career of Leontiev as a singer.
In 1972, Leontiev went to Syktyvkar for a festival competition among amateur creative youth "We are looking for talents" and wins it.
A year later, the director of the Syktyvkar Philharmonic took the group, which included Leontiev, back to Syktyvkar.
In Syktyvkar Leontiev worked as a soloist in the ensemble of "Dreamers", and in 1975 became the soloist of the ensemble "Echo" with which he traveled all over the Soviet Union.

Climbing on the big stage began for the singer later - after the transition to the Gorky Philharmonic and receiving first Prize at the All-Union competition for the best performance of songs of the socialist countries in 1979.

Less than a year later, Leontiev already gave a full-fledged solo concert in Moscow Variety Theatre, and for the performance of compositions by David Tukhmanov "Dance time in the sun" he received First prize of the International Festival "Golden Orpheus".

Less than a year later, Leontiev already gave a full-fledged solo concert in Moscow Variety Theatre, and for the performance of compositions by David Tukhmanov "Dance time in the sun" he received First prize of the International Festival "Golden Orpheus".
In 1980 Leontiev sang in various concerts, including the Moscow Variety Theatre, Oktyabrsky and Luzhniki.
In 1981, the artist won the popularity prize at the prestigious music festival Yerevan-81.
However, this fact caused opposition of the leaders of the Soviet stage and officials, therefore, until 1984, Leontiev fell into disgrace.
The artist overcame it with the help of one of the influential composers of those years - Raimond Pauls.
In 1982, Leontiev underwent a serious operation to remove a tumor from his throat, which jeopardized his further singing career.
Fortunately, in 1983, the singer was able to return to the stage, the artist gives 18 sold-out concerts entitled "I'm just a singer" in Leningrad.
In 1983, the singer moves to work in the Voroshilovgrad Philharmonic (now Luhansk Philharmonic) in the Ukrainian SSR.
In 1983, the singer moves to work in the Voroshilovgrad Philharmonic (now Luhansk Philharmonic) in the Ukrainian SSR.
A year later, he was given a whole section in the author's evening "Holy love of music" by composer Raimond Pauls in Moscow.
A year later, he was given a whole section in the author's evening "Holy love of music" by composer Raimond Pauls in Moscow.
In 1985, Leontiev received the Lenin Komsomol Prize.
1986 was marked by a trip to Chernobyl, where the singer performed.
And in 1987 Leontiev already became Merited Artist of Ukrainian SSR.
In 1991 Leontiev was named the "Best Selling Soviet Artist" at the World Music Awards ceremony in Monte Carlo.
In 1994 he performed on stage with Gina Lollobrigida in Saint-Petersburg concert hall "Oktyabrskiy", and in 1996 he was awarded the title People's Artist of Russia.
In 1994 he performed on stage with Gina Lollobrigida in Saint-Petersburg concert hall "Oktyabrskiy", and in 1996 he was awarded the title People's Artist of Russia.
in March 1998 а nominal star of Valery Leontiev was opened on the Star Square in Moscow.
in 1999 Leontiev was  awarded the "Living Legend Award" at the Russian national music award "Ovation".
